newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia stadium issue only third sold - paper.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia stadium issue only third sold - paper.

text.p: The investment banks underwriting the A$364.4 million float of Sydney's Olympic Stadium had sold only a third of the issue and were now exposed to a A$240 shortfall, The Sydney Morning Herald newspaper reported on Thursday.

"As the troubled float of Stadium Australia moves into its fifth and supposedly final month there is strong talk the promoters have sold only about a third of the total issue," the newspaper said. The four underwriters are ANZ Securities, Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, Macquarie Bank Ltd, and ABN Amro Hoare Govett.
"Sources said exposures varied amoung the four underwriters," the Herald said.
"Deutsche and ANZ are believed to have the greatest exposure while Macquarie Bank has sold the most gold passes of the four brokers," the newspaper said.
ABN Amro had the smallest exposure due to sub-underwriting agreements, it said
